page.title: 07KNOLL LODGE
page.content:
To get to{Knoll Lodge,}you go down{Dog {Kennel Lane}and opposite{Mill Dam {House}is{Knoll Lodge,}you cannot see the grounds because a high fence and hedge is in the way.A footpath goes through the grounds,starting through a kissing gate,over a short wooden bridge and continuing parallel with the drive until it gets to the old stable which is now lived in.Now only a bank and a belt of trees separates it from one of the two lakes used only for private pleasure.It continues down to the bottom of{Yew Tree Lane}.{The {Stables}are about 30-40 years old.You cannot see the{Lodge}for there is a long drive and a tall gate.The trees bordering the drive have been planted for decoration.
Tommy Cowley
